title: Classic TV Doctors
description: Famous TV doctor shows and medical dramas

questions.question: Who played the title character in the long-running medical drama 'Marcus Welby, M.D.'?
What was the name of the fictional hospital in the TV series 'General Hospital,' which debuted in 1963?
Richard Chamberlain starred as the young intern in which 1960s medical drama?
Vince Edwards played what intense, no-nonsense neurosurgeon in a 1960s TV series?
Which actor starred as Dr. Joe Gannon in the 1969-1976 series 'Medical Center'?
In 'M*A*S*H,' what was the nickname of the skilled surgeon played by Alan Alda?
What was the setting of the TV series 'M*A*S*H'?
options: A World War II field hospital
A Korean War mobile army surgical hospital

questions.question: Which actress played nurse Dixie McCall in the 1970s series 'Emergency!'?
In 'Trapper John, M.D.,' who played the older version of the 'M*A*S*H' character?
Which classic TV show featured Dr. Leonard McCoy as the ship's physician?
options: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea

questions.question: What was Dr. McCoy's famous catchphrase on 'Star Trek'?
The TV series 'Quincy, M.E.' starred Jack Klugman as what type of doctor?
Which 1970s show featured paramedics John Gage and Roy DeSoto working with doctors at Rampart Hospital?
Who played the kind country doctor in the 1970s TV series 'The Waltons'?
In 'Doogie Howser, M.D.,' what was remarkable about the title character?
options: He was a teenage genius doctor
He practiced medicine in the Old West
